sen.j: 縁日(えんにち)とは、神仏との有縁（うえん）の日のことである。
sen.e: Ennichi are days when people have a spiritual connection with Shinto or Buddhist deities.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処
sen.e: Ennichi are days when people have a spiritual connection with Shinto or Buddhist deities.
Ennichi are days when people have a spiritual connection with Shinto or Buddhist deities.

sen.j: 神仏の降誕・示現・誓願などの縁（ゆかり）のある日を選んで、祭祀や供養が行われる日である。
sen.e: Days related to Shinto or Buddhist deities such as their births, manifestations and oaths have been selected for ennichi, and religious or memorial services are held on these days.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処
sen.e: Days related to Shinto or Buddhist deities such as their births, manifestations and oaths have been selected for ennichi, and religious or memorial services are held on these days.
Days related to Shinto or Buddhist deities such as their births, manifestations and oaths have been selected for ennichi, and religious or memorial services are held on these days.

sen.j: この日に参詣すると、普段以上の御利益があると信じられた。
sen.e: It was believed that one would receive more blessing than usual if he or she visited a shrine or temple on these days.
It was believed that one would receive more blessing than usual if he or she visited a shrine or temple on these days.
It was believed that one would receive more blessing than usual if he or she visited a shrine or temple on these days.

sen.j: 特に、年の最初（または月の最初）の縁日を初（はつ）○○（初天神、初観音、初不動など。干支を縁日とする場合は初午、初巳など）と称する。
sen.e: The first ennichi of the year (or the first ones of the month), in particular, are specifically named by attaching the word "hatsu" (first) to the beginning of their names, for example, Hatsu-Tenjin (first ennichi for Michizane SUGAWARA enshrined at Tenmangu shrines), Hatsu-Kannon (first ennichi for Kannon, or Goddess of Mercy), and Hatsu-Fudo (first ennichi for Fudo Myoo, or Acala, one of the Five Wisdom Kings); in cases of ennichi for the Chinese zodiac, they are referred to as Hatsu-Uma (first day of the Horse) and Hatsu-Mi (first day of the Snake).

The first ennichi of the year (or the first ones of the month), in particular, are specifically named by attaching the word "hatsu" (first) to the beginning of their names, for example, Hatsu-Tenjin (first ennichi for Michizane SUGAWARA enshrined at Tenmangu Shrines), Hatsu-Kannon (first ennichi for Kannon, or Goddess of Mercy), and Hatsu-Fudo (first ennichi for Fudo Myoo, or Acala, one of the Five Wisdom Kings); in cases of ennichi for the Chinese zodiac, they are referred to as Hatsu-Uma (first day of the Horse) and Hatsu-Mi (first day of the Snake).

The first ennichi of the year (or the first ones of the month), in particular, are specifically named by attaching the word "hatsu" (first) to the beginning of their names, for example, Hatsu-Tenjin (first ennichi for Michizane SUGAWARA enshrined at Tenmangu Shrines), Hatsu-Kannon (first ennichi for Kannon, or Goddess of Mercy), and Hatsu-Fudo (first ennichi for Fudo Myoo, or Acala, one of the Five Wisdom Kings); in cases of ennichi for the Chinese zodiac, they are referred to as Hatsu-Uma (first day of the Horse) and Hatsu-Mi (first day of the Snake).

sen.j: 年の最後の縁日を納め（おさめ）の○○または終い（しまい）○○と称される。
sen.e: The last ennichi of the year are named by attaching the word "Osame no" (ending) or "Shimai" (last) to the beginning of the names.
The last ennichi of the year are named by attaching the word "Osame no" (ending) or "Shimai" (last) to the beginning of the names.
The last ennichi of the year are named by attaching the word "Osame no" (ending) or "Shimai" (last) to the beginning of the names.

sen.j: 近代以降では、神社などで行われる祭り(露店などが多く出る)の日のことを指す場合も多い。
sen.e: Since the modern era, ennichi has also often indicated to the days when festivals (with many street stalls) are held at places such as shrines.
Since the modern era, ennichi has also often indicated the days when festivals (with many street stalls) are held at places such as shrines.
sen.cmt: has indicated to the days を has indicated the daysに変更
sen.e: Since the modern era, ennichi has also often indicated the days when festivals (with many street stalls) are held at places such as shrines.

sen.j: 毘沙門天 - 1月,5月,9月の最初の寅の日

sen.e: Arakawa yuenchimae Station: every date whose units digit is two (every 2nd, 12th and 22nd of the month)

tit.cmt: 題名なので単語の先頭を大文字化（除く前置詞）

sen.j: 屋台。
sen.e: Street stall
Street Stall
Street Stall

sen.j: 縁日の風物詩の出店として伝統的にみられるもの。
sen.e: Street stalls have traditionally been a special feature for ennichi.
Street stalls have traditionally been a special feature for ennichi.
Street stalls have traditionally been a special feature for ennichi.

sen.j: 盆踊りの出店とほぼ同じ。
sen.e: The stalls for ennichi are almost the same as the ones for Bon festival dance.
The stalls for ennichi are almost the same as the ones for Bon festival dance.
The stalls for ennichi are almost the same as the ones for Bon festival dance.

sen.j: 下記以外にもたこ焼き、焼きそば、磯部など日常見かける屋台も並ぶ。
sen.e: In addition to the street stalls mentioned below, familiar stalls selling food such as takoyaki (octopus dumplings), yakisoba (Japanese fried noodle) and isobe (grilled mochi wrapped in dried seaweed) are set up.

In addition to the street stalls mentioned below, familiar stalls selling food such as takoyaki (octopus dumplings), yakisoba (Japanese fried noodle) and isobe (grilled mochi wrapped in dried seaweed) are set up.

In addition to the street stalls mentioned below, familiar stalls selling food such as takoyaki (octopus dumplings), yakisoba (Japanese fried noodle) and isobe (grilled mochi wrapped in dried seaweed) are set up.

sen.j: これらは子供はもとより、童心に帰った大人・青年らの関心も集める。
sen.e: These stalls attract not only children but also adults and youth who feel like kids.
These stalls attract not only children but also adults and youths who feel like kids.
These stalls attract not only children but also adults and youths who feel like kids.

sen.j: なお、これらの一部は、冬季の縁日には出店しない（夏を中心に、4月～10月頃のみ出店する）。
sen.e: Incidentally, some of the stalls do not open for ennichi in the winter season; they open for ennichi from April to October, especially in the summer.
Incidentally, some of the stalls do not open for ennichi in the winter season; they open for ennichi from April to October, especially in the summer.
Incidentally, some of the stalls do not open for ennichi in the winter season; they open for ennichi from April to October, especially in the summer.

sen.j: こうした屋台で見られる商品は、粗悪品であったり、原価の数十～数百倍で販売されていることが多い。
sen.e: Products at these street stalls are often inferior or sold for ten to hundred times as much as the original costs.
Products at these street stalls are often inferior or sold for ten to hundred times as much as the original costs.
Products at these street stalls are often inferior or sold for ten to hundred times as much as the original costs.

sen.j: 綿菓子
sen.e: Cotton candy
Cotton Candy
sen.cmt: 題名なので単語の先頭を大文字化
sen.e: Cotton Candy

sen.j: - キザラを高温で熱し、綿状にした菓子。
sen.e: It is cotton-like candy made by heating coarse sugar at high temperature.
It is a cotton-like candy made by heating coarse sugar at high temperature.
sen.cmt: candyは可算名詞なので不定冠詞を付けた。
sen.e: It is a cotton-like candy made by heating coarse sugar at high temperature.

sen.j: リンゴ飴
sen.e: Candy apple
Ringo-Ame (sweetened apple)
sen.cmt: 題名をApple candy からRingo-Ameに変更
sen.e: Ringo-Ame (sweetened apple)

sen.j: - リンゴに飴を絡ませた物。
sen.e: It is a candy of a whole apple dipped in starch syrup.
It is a candy of apple which is coated with a melted and sticky liquid sugar or syrop.
sen.cmt: 説明を用語集から流用
sen.e: It is a candy of apple which is coated with a melted and sticky liquid sugar or syrop.

sen.j: 現在は小さなリンゴなどもリンゴ飴にしている。
sen.e: Small apples are also used for candy apple today.
Small apples are also used for ringo-ame today.
Small apples are also used for ringo-ame today.

sen.j: あんず飴
sen.e: Anzu-ame (candied apricot)
Anzu-Ame (candied apricot)
Anzu-Ame (candied apricot)

sen.j: - 果物に飴をからめた菓子。
sen.e: It is a candy of fruit dipped in starch syrup.
It is a candy of fruit which is coated with a melted and sticky liquid sugar or syrop.
sen.cmt: 「飴をからめた」の部分の説明を変更
sen.e: It is a candy of fruit which is coated with a melted and sticky liquid sugar or syrop.

sen.j: ベビーカステラ
sen.e: Baby kasutera (small kasutera, or sponge cake)
Baby Kasutera (small kasutera, or sponge cake)
sen.cmt: kasteraをKasteraとした（先頭の大文字化）
sen.e: Baby Kasutera (small kasutera, or sponge cake)

sen.j: - 小さなカステラという意味だが、ホットケーキの丸めた物という感じ。
sen.e: Baby kasutera means small kasutera, but its shape is in fact like a folded pancake.
Baby kasutera means small kasutera, but its shape is in fact like a rolled-up pancake.
sen.cmt: 「丸めた」の訳をfolded から rolled upに変更
sen.e: Baby kasutera means small kasutera, but its shape is in fact like a rolled-up pancake.

sen.j: 東京ケーキ、チンチン焼、ピンス焼の名で売られることもある。
sen.e: It may be sold under the name of "Tokyo Cake," "Chinchin-yaki" or "Binsu-yaki."
It may be sold under the name of "Tokyo Cake," "Chinchin-yaki" or "Binsu-yaki."
It may be sold under the name of "Tokyo Cake," "Chinchin-yaki" or "Binsu-yaki."

sen.j: ソース煎餅
sen.e: Sauce senbei (rice cracker dipped in a sauce)
Sauce Senbei (rice cracker dipped in a sauce)
Sauce Senbei (rice cracker dipped in a sauce)

sen.j: - デン助賭博のようなルーレット状の籤で当選した枚数の薄い煎餅と、おたふくソース (調味料)や梅ジャム等各種「タレ」のセット。
sen.e: It is a set of thin senbei of which one receives as many pieces as the number he or she wins on a roulette-like game seen in "densuke tobaku" (fake street gambling) and a sauce such as Otafuku sauce (a sauce produced at OTAFUKU SAUCE Co., Ltd.) or plum jam.
sen.cmt: 原文には、「おたふくソース (調味料)」 とありますが、「(調味料)」はリンク先の単語のようです。ウェブで確認すると用語は「おたふくソース」とだけなっております。
sen.e: It is a set of thin senbei of which one receives as many pieces as the number he or she wins on a roulette-like game seen in "densuke tobaku" (fake street gambling) and a sauce such as Otafuku sauce (a sauce produced by OTAFUKU SAUCE Co., Ltd.) or plum jam.
sen.cmt: produced at を produced by に変更
sen.e: It is a set of thin senbei of which one receives as many pieces as the number he or she wins on a roulette-like game seen in "densuke tobaku" (fake street gambling) and a sauce such as Otafuku sauce (a sauce produced by OTAFUKU SAUCE Co., Ltd.) or plum jam.

sen.j: カラ籤はないが、5～10枚の当選範囲が多くしてある。
sen.e: There is no blank for the game, and the winning numbers range mostly between five and ten.
There is no blank for the game, and the winning numbers range mostly between five and ten.
There is no blank for the game, and the winning numbers range mostly between five and ten.

sen.j: お面
sen.e: Mask
Mask
Mask

sen.j: - プラスチック製のアニメ・ゲーム・特撮等の人気キャラクターのものを販売する。
sen.e: Plastic masks of popular characters from animation, games, and tokusatsu (Japanese television dramas with special effects that usually feature superheroes) are sold.
Plastic masks of popular characters from animation, games, and tokusatsu (Japanese television dramas with special effects that usually feature superheroes) are sold.
Plastic masks of popular characters from animation, games, and tokusatsu (Japanese television dramas with special effects that usually feature superheroes) are sold.

sen.j: 金魚すくい
sen.e: Goldfish scooping
Goldfish Scooping
Goldfish Scooping

sen.j: - 小さな金魚を掬う。
sen.e: One scoops small gold fish.
One scoops small gold fish.
One scoops small gold fish.

sen.j: 大抵は高級金魚養殖の選抜で間引かれた個体で、元々弱っていることが多いため一晩で死んでしまうことも多いが、育て方が上手だと結構良い形に成長する。
sen.e: Most of these goldfish die overnight because they are often the weak ones that have been removed in the process of farming expensive goldfish; however, they will grow up to be fairly well-shaped goldfish if raised properly.

Most of the scooped goldfish die in a day because they are basically unhealthy ones that have been excluded from the group of an expensive type of goldfish during the farming process; however, they will grow up to be fairly well-shaped goldfish if raised properly.

Most of the scooped goldfish die in a day because they are basically unhealthy ones that have been excluded from the group of an expensive type of goldfish during the farming process; however, they will grow up to be fairly well-shaped goldfish if raised properly.

sen.j: ひよこ
sen.e: Chick
Chick
Chick

sen.j: - 養鶏場で商品価値の低い雄の ひよこの処分手段として売られているケースが殆ど。
sen.e: Male chicks of little commercial value are mostly sold as a means to getting rid of them from poultry farms.
Male chicks of little commercial value are mostly sold as a means to getting rid of them from poultry farms.
Male chicks of little commercial value are mostly sold as a means to getting rid of them from poultry farms.

sen.j: スプレーで着色し「カラーひよこ」と称して売ったり、稀にウズラの子(シマドリとも)などを売るものもあった。
sen.e: Some vendors used to spray chicks and sell them as "color chick"; in rare cases, furthermore, baby quails (also called as shimadori) were sold.
Some vendors used to spray chicks with some color and sell them as a "color chick"; once in a great while, furthermore, baby quails (also called as shimadori) were sold.
Some vendors used to spray chicks with some color and sell them as a "color chick"; once in a great while, furthermore, baby quails (also called as shimadori) were sold.

sen.j: 近年は動物愛護の風潮もあってか、余り見かけなくなった。
sen.e: These chicks are rarely sold nowadays probably due to the awareness of animal welfare.
These chicks are rarely sold nowadays probably due to the awareness of animal protection.
sen.cmt: animal welfareを animal protectionに変更
sen.e: These chicks are rarely sold nowadays probably due to the awareness of animal protection.

sen.j: 型ぬき菓子
sen.e: Katanuki gashi
Katanuki Gashi
sen.cmt: 題名なので単語の先頭を大文字化
sen.e: Katanuki Gashi

sen.j: - 型ヌキ、ヌキなどの通称で呼ばれる。
sen.e: It is commonly called "katanuki" or "nuki."
It is commonly called "katanuki" or "nuki."
It is commonly called "katanuki" or "nuki."

sen.j: 小麦粉などで作って色づけされた板の絵柄を爪楊枝や針などで削る遊び。
sen.e: It is a game in which one cuts out, with a toothpick or needle, the print on a colored sheet made from materials such as flour.
It is a game in which one cuts out, with a toothpick or needle, a picture on a colored sheet made from materials such as flour.
sen.cmt: 「絵柄」の訳をthe printからa pictureに変更
sen.e: It is a game in which one cuts out, with a toothpick or needle, a picture on a colored sheet made from materials such as flour.

sen.j: 名前に菓子とあるが食品ではない。
sen.e: Katanuki gashi is not for consumption although the name includes the word "gashi" (confection).
Katanuki gashi is not for consumption although the name includes the word "gashi" (confection).
Katanuki gashi is not for consumption although the name includes the word "gashi" (confection).

sen.j: ヨーヨー釣り
sen.e: Yo-yo fishing
Yo-yo Fishing
sen.cmt: fishing を Fishing とした。
sen.e: Yo-yo Fishing

sen.j: - カラフルな模様の水風船をかぎ針で吊り上げる遊び。
sen.e: It is a game in which one fishes water balloons with colorful designs with a hook.
It is a game in which one fishes water balloons with colorful designs with a hook.
It is a game in which one fishes water balloons with colorful designs with a hook.

sen.j: チョコバナナ
sen.e: Choco banana (literally, chocolate banana)
Choco Banana (literally, chocolate banana)
sen.cmt: bananaを Bananaとした（題名なので）。
sen.e: Choco Banana (literally, chocolate banana)

sen.j: - 丸ごとのバナナをチョコレートでコーティングした菓子。
sen.e: It is a confection of a whole banana covered in chocolate.
It is a confection of banana coated with chocolate.
sen.cmt: 「コーティングした」の訳をcoated withに変更
sen.e: It is a confection of banana coated with chocolate.

sen.j: コルク射的
sen.e: Cork shooting
Cork Bullet Shooting
sen.cmt: Cork shootingをCork Bullet Shootingとした。
sen.e: Cork Bullet Shooting

sen.j: - 遊戯銃でコルク弾を打ち出し、倒した景品をもらえる遊び。
sen.e: It is a game in which one shoots a cork bullet from a toy gun and receives as a prize the item that the bullet knocks over.
It is a game in which one shoots a cork bullet from a toy gun and receives as a prize the item that the bullet has knocked over.
sen.cmt: knocks overをhas knocked overと完了形に変更
sen.e: It is a game in which one shoots a cork bullet from a toy gun and receives as a prize the item that the bullet has knocked over.

sen.j: スマートボール
sen.e: Smart ball
Smart Ball
sen.cmt: balll をBallとし先頭を大文字化
sen.e: Smart Ball

sen.j: - 横になったパチンコ台でボールを穴に入れる遊び。
sen.e: It is a game in which one hits balls into holes on the pachinko (Japanese pinball) board laid down horizontally.
It is a game in which one hits balls so as to guide them into holes on a pachinko (Japanese pinball) board placed horizontally.
It is a game in which one hits balls so as to guide them into holes on a pachinko (Japanese pinball) board placed horizontally.
